snippet: The author of a memoir is no longer quite as thrilled that all her youthful misadventures have their own I.S.B.N.
abstract: Noelle Howey Author's Note reflects on how it is likely her children will some day read her memoir Dress Codes: Of Three Girlhoods--My Mother's, My Father's, and Mine and ask her about all that is revealed there; notes that despite some regrets about way people or events were portrayed, she remains proud of her book.
lead_paragraph: The author of a memoir is no longer quite as thrilled that all her youthful misadventures have their own I.S.B.N.
